title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \geq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y \geq \frac{-1}{2} x+2$$ $$0 \geq 0\frac{-1}{2}+2$$ $$0 \geq 2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is not a solution to $$y \geq \frac{-1}{2} x+2$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the right side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y \leq \frac{3}{4} x$$ on the same grid.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \leq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (1,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y \leq \frac{3}{4} x$$ $$0 \leq 1\frac{3}{4}$$ $$0 \leq \frac{3}{4}$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (1,0) is a solution to $$y \leq \frac{3}{4} x$$. Since (1,0) is on the right side of the line, so we shade in the rigjt side of the line $$y=\frac{3}{4} x$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
